content.raw:
We should be able to split the special release type from the version argument:

`ign_configure_project(common 0.5.0 pre)`

The `pre` would fall into the `${ARGV}` of `ign_configure_project(~)`.

From this, we could construct the "full version" type as `0.5.0~pre`. We may also need to consider doing something like [this](https://github.com/google/protobuf/pull/1624) in order for cmake users to correctly find special release versions using `find_package(~)`.

Edit: Alternatively, if we can come up with a fixed list of special release types that we are willing to support, we could have them as optional arguments: `ign_configure_project(common 0.5.0 PRE)` where `PRE` (or `ALPHA` or `BETA`) are predetermined optional arguments which tell `ignition-cmake` to configure the project as the special release type. This would be forwards-compatible with any potential changes we might want to make to `ign_configure_project(~)` in the future.
